Description: A sigil passed down through Watatsumi Island and Enkanomiya. Each of the five Key Sigils is unique in its structure.

Name: Key Sigil
Description: A Key Sigil passed down through Watatsumi Island and Enkanomiya. When people left the ocean depths, they combined various Key Sigils to create the Sangonomiya house emblem.

Name: Key Sigil
Description: A sigil passed down through Watatsumi Island and Enkanomiya. It conceals some secret.

Name: Bloodbranch Coral
Description: A coral in which the life force of Watatsumi Omikami dwells. It is a vital part of the Watatsumi Goryou Matsuri.

Name: Divine Bridle
Description: A symbol of the Sunchild's authority, made in the shape of a bridle. It does not possess any special power by itself.

Name: Date's Medal of Recognition
Description: A medal that represents Date's recognition. It is very well-made.

Name: Date's Medal of Recognition
Description: A medal representing Date's recognition. It is very well-made. If you look at it long enough, the labyrinth-wanderlust might actually overtake you!

Name: Secret Room Key
Description: A key that opens the door to a certain secret room in The Narrows. This might be one of the abandoned safehouses that Adonis and his compatriots once used.

Name: Waters of Lethe
Description: Water from a river that flows near the Evernight Temple. It shines with a faint light in the darkness. Directly ingesting this liquid will not cause you to forget anything, but the Dragonbone Orb created through its auspices has this effect.

Name: Dragonbone Orb
Description: The fruit of the Dragonbone Flower, created via the use of the Waters of Lethe. It is said to sweep one's worries away and bring peace. Giving up your objectives, forsaking desire, and becoming content and satisfied... Is that not happiness?

Name: Key to Some Place
Description:
A key found in Tatarasuna.
Where there's a key, there's got to be a lock to match.

Name: Key to Some Place
Description:
A key found in Tatarasuna.
Where there's a key, there's got to be a lock to match.

Name: Key to Some Place
Description:
A key found in Tatarasuna.
Where there's a key, there's got to be a lock to match.

Name: Sun-Dried Sweet Flower
Description: A dried flower from Hanayama Kaoru. It was the first flower to grow in that brand-new floral sea.

Name: Peculiar Pinion
Description: A strange feather you discovered after defeating the monster on the summit of Amakumo Peak.

Name: Maushiro
Description:
An item that Sumida tasked you to find.
You found this Maushiro on Tsurumi Island, and it seems to be a traditional instrument around these parts.
That said, it should have been at least a few thousand years since Tsurumi Island last played host to any civilization at all.

Name: Maushiro
Description:
The item that Sumida sent you to find.
This Maushiro appears to have been left behind by someone before they left Tsurumi Island.
According to what Ruu tells you, the Maushiro are not musical instruments. Instead, they were used by the locals as a means of locating one another amidst the fog that shrouded their home.

Name: An Onikabuto Affected by Tatarigami
Description: An onikabuto that has fallen under the influence of Tatarigami. Who knows what sort of tests Xavier wants to put it through...

Name: Missing Component(s)
Description: A component that fell from the Purification Device.

Name: Musoujin Gorge: Rock Pillar Pearl
Description: A precious pearl that emits Electro energy and a strangely-colored light. It seems to have some connection with the rock pillars on the island.

Name: Musoujin Gorge: Rock Pillar Warding Stone
Description: A gem that has an electric scent and that is quite shocking to the touch. It has some unknown connection to the rock pillars on the island.

Name: Serpent's Head: Rock Pillar Pearl
Description: A precious pearl that emits Electro energy and a strangely-colored light. It seems to have some connection with the rock pillars on the island.

Name: Serpent's Head: Rock Pillar Warding Stone
Description: A gem that has an electric scent and that is quite shocking to the touch. It has some unknown connection to the rock pillars on the island.

Name: Jakotsu Mine: Rock Pillar Pearl
Description: A precious pearl that emits Electro energy and a strangely-colored light. It seems to have some connection with the rock pillars on the island.

Name: Jakotsu Mine: Rock Pillar Warding Stone
Description: A gem that has an electric scent and that is quite shocking to the touch. It has some unknown connection to the rock pillars on the island.

Name: Fort Mumei: Rock Pillar Pearl
Description: A precious pearl that emits Electro energy and a strangely-colored light. It seems to have some connection with the rock pillars on the island.

Name: Fort Mumei: Rock Pillar Warding Stone
Description: A gem that has an electric scent and that is quite shocking to the touch. It has some unknown connection to the rock pillars on the island.

Name: Naku Weed Seed
Description: A bag of Naku Weed seeds.

Name: High-Quality Chilled Meat
Description: Chilled Meat that appears to be of high quality. It should make for some good cooking indeed.

Name: Piping-Hot Braised Meat
Description: Braised Meat made using the Supreme Cuisine Machine. Fresh and steaming hot.

Name: Family Letter
Description: The page has already yellowed and become incredibly brittle. A single touch might break it.

Name: Tattered Letter
Description: Someone's private thoughts are written in this tattered letter. Unfortunately, the years have eaten away at the words that were penned until they became blurred, and if not for someone having dug it up, these past events may have forever slept under the soil.

Name: Pharmacist's Notebook (I)
Description: Notes left by Yasumoto. They still smell strongly of Naku Weed.

Name: Pharmacist's Notebook (II)
Description: Notes left by Yasumoto. It has been conscientiously protected from rain damage.

Name: Pharmacist's Notebook (III)
Description: Notes left by Yasumoto. It shows some signs of blotching and water damage.

Name: Unsealed Letter
Description: A letter that seems brand new but that has already been opened. It gives off a light sakura scent.

Name: Inaba Tousaburou Kyuuzou's Final Words
Description: A letter filled with words from margin to margin. Its author has gone missing.

Name: Star-Shaped Gem
Description:
A mysterious gem of unknown make. It shines like a star even when placed inside your backpack.
Perhaps this is the key to completing a certain "image."

Name: Stone Slate
Description:
A stone slate with Ishine Script carved into it.
Perhaps it may be of some use on Tsurumi Island...?

Name: Kamuijima Cannon Map
Description: A map that records the positions of the Kamuijima Cannons.

Name: High-Quality Rice
Description: High-quality rice that you obtained from Brunn. It looks like it'll cook well.

Name: Fragrant Rice Pudding
Description: Rice Pudding made using the Supreme Cuisine Machine. One wonders how it might taste...

Name: Anemo Slime-Swallowed Bamboo Shoots
Description: Bamboo Shoots that have been swallowed by Anemo Slimes. Who knows what special flavor they might add...

Name: Piping-Hot Oncidium Tofu
Description: Oncidium Tofu made using the Supreme Cuisine Machine. One wonders what flavors this is going to have...

Name: Fossil Bag
Description: A bag containing the suspected fossil of the Lunar Leviathan. Give it to Kujirai Momiji... though one wonders if she can accept this reality.

Name: "Treasury" Key
Description: A key treasured by the bandits. This must be one of the keys to finding the secret treasure... right?

Name: Incomplete Notes
Description: A tattered page. For some reason, it gives off the stench of stale grain.

Name: Tattered Paper
Description: A crumpled note with very messy, illegible handwriting.

Name: Picture Commemorating Seirai Island
Description: A picture of some place on Seirai Island. Who knows why it would be buried here...

Name: Picture Commemorating Seirai Island (II)
Description: A picture you got from Mr. Oda Tarou, it seems to show some place on Seirai Island...

Name: Picture Commemorating Seirai Island (III)
Description: A picture you got from Mr. Oda Tarou, it seems to show some place on Seirai Island...

Name: Picture Commemorating Seirai Island (IV)
Description: A picture you got from Mr. Oda Tarou, it seems to show some place on Seirai Island...

Name: Fujiwara Toshiko's Treasure Map
Description: A treasure map you obtained from Fujiwara Toshiko. According to her, this map hides the means by which certain mechanisms may be activated.

Name: A Bag of Beans
Description:
Beans you got from Sango. Arataki Itto seems to be allergic to beans, so these may prove to be useful tools in stopping him from resisting too much.
Sango says they're not free, though. Hopefully they don't cost too much...

Name: Right-Side Photo
Description: A picture of Neko, taken from the right.

Name: Left-Side Photo
Description: A picture of Neko, taken from the left.

Name: Inferior Starsilver
Description: Starsilver with low luster and dull coloration. It will most likely not sell for a high price.

Name: Quality Starsilver
Description: Starsilver with great luster and a lovely coloration.

Name: Key
Description: A unique-looking key. You can open the cage holding Bennett with it.

Name: Box of Clothes
Description: This box contains the clothes that Ningguang asked you to go get. As she said, "I need a change of mood, and a change of clothes will facilitate that."

Name: Torn Page: Toki Alley Tales (Prologue)
Description:
Collect all 10 pages to form Toki Alley Tales (Prologue).

This page billows about in the breeze, seemingly having dropped from a very old novel.
Perhaps you might be able to reconstruct the complete text, should you find other torn pages elsewhere.

Name: Torn Page: Toki Alley Tales (I)
Description:
Collect all 10 pages to form Toki Alley Tales (I).

This page billows about in the breeze, seemingly having dropped from a very old novel.
Perhaps you might be able to reconstruct the complete text, should you find other torn pages elsewhere.

Name: Torn Page: Toki Alley Tales (II)
Description:
Collect all 10 pages to form Toki Alley Tales (II).

This page billows about in the breeze, seemingly having dropped from a very old novel.
Perhaps you might be able to reconstruct the complete text, should you find other torn pages elsewhere.

Name: Torn Page: Toki Alley Tales (III)
Description:
Collect all 10 pages to form Toki Alley Tales (III).

This page billows about in the breeze, seemingly having dropped from a very old novel.
Perhaps you might be able to reconstruct the complete text, should you find other torn pages elsewhere.

Name: Torn Page: Toki Alley Tales (IV)
Description:
Collect all 10 pages to form Toki Alley Tales (IV).

This page billows about in the breeze, seemingly having dropped from a very old novel.
Perhaps you might be able to reconstruct the complete text, should you find other torn pages elsewhere.

Name: Torn Page: Toki Alley Tales (V)
Description:
Collect all 10 pages to form Toki Alley Tales (V).

This page billows about in the breeze, seemingly having dropped from a very old novel.
Perhaps you might be able to reconstruct the complete text, should you find other torn pages elsewhere.

Name: Toki Alley Tales (Prologue)
Description: They say that in the past, when the fragile and short-lived mortals had yet to cross over the sea unto these lands, Inazuma was once a land that belonged to the tanuki. They say, too, that human history began as drunken tanuki nonsense... Welcome to Toki Alley, a place where history and wild tales intertwine.

Name: Toki Alley Tales (I)
Description: The great tengu are naught but brutal braggarts, and especially when drunk! — Tanuki Historical Commentary

Name: Toki Alley Tales (II)
Description: Mother once warned that a beautiful face can hide deceptive intentions. If she looks as lovely as the moonlight, she must either be a fox spirit, or some old bake-neko hag of significant power — Tanuki Historical Commentary

Name: Toki Alley Tales (III)
Description: They say that those who make the ameonna cry will bring inescapable sorrow upon themselves. —Tanuki Historical Commentary

Name: Toki Alley Tales (IV)
Description: The tragedy of mortals is to lack self-knowledge, and that of the youkai is the lack of any such tragic troubles. —Tanuki Historical Commentary

Name: Toki Alley Tales (V)
Description: Will this middle section filled with regret lead to a more interesting story thereafter?

Name: Pass Permit
Description:
A pass permit you obtained from Yae Miko. With this, you can enter Tenshukaku without restrictions and meet the Raiden Shogun.
You heard that this was made for emergencies, but that Yae Miko seems to have never had a chance to use it.

Name: Dango Milk
Description:
A creative snack made by adding sticky dango to milk. It is sweet and has a dense mouthfeel. All the customers who have tried it love it.
Still, it is dango that's been added in — drink too much and you might lose your appetite.

Name: Realm Dispatch
Description:
A realm dispatch that you obtained from Tubby. It seems to be able to allow your companions to come and go in your realm as they please...
After acquiring this item, you can invite companions to reside in your Serenitea Pot from the Placement Screen.

Name: Special Sakura Bloom
Description: A seemingly special Sakura Bloom.

Name: Thunder Sakura Crab
Description: A crab that lives beside the Thunder Sakura. One wonders if it has any unique properties...

Name: Fresh Seagrass
Description: Fresh Seagrass. It looks like it would make a good meal.

Name: Crab Bait
Description: Crab bait that you got from Xudong. Laying it should attract crabs.

Name: Fresh Sakura Bloom
Description: A fresh sakura bloom. One can't be sure how Julie is going to use it in her dish...

Name: Fresh Snapdragon
Description: Fresh snapdragon. It should be most suitable for cooking.

Name: Fresh Bird Egg
Description: A fresh egg that should be most amenable to cooking.

Name: Fresh Mushroom
Description: A mushroom that did not originally grow in this area, but began to grow with wild profusion after absorbing sufficient special nutrition.

Name: New Chronicles of the Six Kitsune: Prologue
Description: Stories about memories are always closely intertwined with transience. This book is not all-new, but is an adaptation of "Urakusai's Chronicles of the Six Kitsune."

Name: New Chronicles of the Six Kitsune (I)
Description: The story of the "Black Fox" Itaru was actually the third volume in the original "Urakusai's Chronicles of the Six Kitsune." It appears at the front of this edition due to the writer's personal preference.

Name: New Chronicles of the Six Kitsune (II)
Description: This volume recounts the clash between "Black Fox Itaru" and the "Twin Oni of Tokaku." This tale was missing from the original text, but it was fortunately rediscovered at a later date. It is presented here in an edited form.

Name: New Chronicles of the Six Kitsune (III)
Description: In the 500-year-old "Urakusai's Chronicles of the Six Kitsune," Youzan and Yui went on to have their own tales. But at this time, the mother-daughter pair are still reliant on Itaru to rescue them.

Name: New Chronicles of the Six Kitsune (IV)
Description: This is the tensest tale of the series, said to have been written by Urakusai upon his return from Liyue. It is featured in full in this writer's adaptation.

Name: Sangonomiya Chronicles
Description: Historical annals written by the famous Shogunate historian Kujou Michizane, who was known as one of the "The Three Kujou Dignitaries," or "The Great Calligrapher." It chronicles the history of Watatsumi Island in broad strokes.

Name: The Saga of Hamavaran (Preface)
Description: The prefaces of the new light novel "The Saga of Hamavaran," now combined into their own separate volume due to a business model adjustment!

Name: The Saga of Hamavaran (I)
Description: "How could this happen..." An ordinary scholar from Sumeru is unexpectedly assigned an unpopular specialization and ordered to go forth to the land of thunder and lightning... The curtains slowly rise on an adventure in the nation of many shores!

Name: The Saga of Hamavaran (II)
Description: "'Ghost-calling'? Is that the same as 'spirit-warding' back home?" With confusing questions swirling in his mind, Hamavaran begins to speak with his newfound traveling companion. An unexpected journey begins!

Name: A Legend of Sword (I)
Description: Amid a sea of stars that spin in reverse, light-centuries of war unfold down on the planet's surface... With this grandiose opening comes an all-new tale of gallantry!

Name: A Legend of Sword (II)
Description: Amid a sea of stars that spin in reverse, no battle is legendary enough to be any more than a ripple in the silence for those who dwell upon the shore... But for the warriors in the thick of it, the war is all there is.

Name: A Legend of Sword (III)
Description: Amid a sea of stars that spin in reverse lies a small chain of shattered isles, each of which has its own history, featuring tales heroic and trivial alike. This heroic tale is set in the time of the Suruga Shogunate.

Name: A Legend of Sword (IV)
Description: There is a saying in Inazuma: "What are bandits but the children of war?" In times of tumult, even the harvest is a battlefield... See how this unfolds in the latest volume of "A Legend of Sword"!

Name: A Legend of Sword (V)
Description: Amid a sea of stars that spin in reverse, in nondescript village in a remote corner of the shattered isles, a ronin who has fallen upon hard times forms an alliance with a group of farmers. A great battle with the bandits draws near...

Name: Sacred Sakura Cleansing Summary
Description: A tattered scroll containing information related to the Sacred Sakura Cleansing Ritual. Some pages seem to bear the cinnabar seal of some shrine.

Name: Diary of Roald the Adventurer: Ritou
Description: A diary left behind by the famed adventurer, Roald. The pages bear both the refreshing scent of sakura flowers and the bitterness of tobacco leaves.

Name: Someone's Diary V: Jinren Island
Description: A diary left behind by someone in the wilderness that tells of the owner's unfortunate encounters at Jinren Island.

Name: Grand Narukami Shrine Omamori
Description:
An omamori given to you by Yae Miko.
"You can take this out and have a look whenever you think of me as well, you know?"

Name: Official Tenryou Commission Document
Description: Obtained from Kujou Takayuki. None are privy to these contents save him and the Shogun — or so they tell you. It has the seal of the Kujou Clan Head on it.

Name: Tenryou Commission Secret Letter
Description: Obtained from Kujou Takayuki. The contents are a bit ambiguous, but it isn't difficult to see that some of it involves an exchange of intelligence with the Fatui.

Name: Supersized Firework
Description: Yoimiya's pride and joy as the current owner of Naganohara Fireworks. It still seems to be in an experimental state. Nothing's going to go wrong... right?

Name: Special Magical Crystal Ore
Description: The Special Magical Crystal Ore mentioned in the sailing log. It looks exactly the same as normal magical crystal ore, so there must be some other key factor that allows it to attract the Lunar Leviathan.

Name: Ore Slag
Description: Slag left behind amidst some ore on Dragonspine. The valuable portions have been taken away, and the rest is just worthless, useless dross — or at least, that's how people might be inclined to see it. They would have carried it off as well otherwise, right?

Name: Princess Mina of the Fallen Nation (I)
Description:
The princess who was prophesied to bring destruction witnesses the imminent fall of her nation, and it is at this moment when a wandering warrior descends from the skies, ignorant of the truth.
The pair's journey amidst the fires of an ancient warring period are about to begin!

Name: Princess Mina of the Fallen Nation (II)
Description:
"A princess who brings destruction. Hah. Isn't that just an excuse for making war?"
They travel to the center of the world in search of the truth behind the prophecy.
The super-popular romantic adventure continues!

Name: Princess Mina of the Fallen Nation (III)
Description:
The two, who have entered the field of battle, finally witness the true Avici. The truth behind the fires of war that have swept across the world will be revealed here!
This volume comes with some super value-added extras!

Name: Princess Mina of the Fallen Nation (IV)
Description:
"Go back to hell, you jumped-up vengeful spirit!"
The riveting flashback chapter! What lies within the warrior's buried past?
Here comes a new chapter in the adventures of the princess who lost her nation and the warrior!

Name: Princess Mina of the Fallen Nation (V)
Description:
"If this world requires your sacrifice to be saved, then it might as well burn."
Having reached the Sky Tower at the heart of the world at last, is this... finally the end of the pair's tale?

Name: Princess Mina of the Fallen Nation (VI)
Description:
The truth of the world is revealed — and what a terrible joke it is! Even when separated, the two cannot escape the chains of fate.
This may be the final volume of "Princess Mina of the Fallen Nation," but our story isn't over yet!

Name: Flowers for Princess Fischl (0)
Description:
The preliminary volume of the "Flowers for Princess Fischl" series.
This work originally came in a violet and black wooden box as a limited edition gift, but many hardcore fans of the series who wanted to collect the whole saga were enraged by the great amount of content versus the small number of copies printed.
Due to this, Yae Publishing House would name this book "Volume 0" and sell it separately. Eventually, the original work, the boxed collector's edition, and Volume 0 would all come to be regarded as standard by fans.

Name: Teyvat Travel Guide - Inazuma
Description: A magazine by the Adventurers' Guild. Each issue introduces great sceneries across Teyvat. This issue includes a short traveling diary of Alice the Traveler in Inazuma.

Name: Drifting Bottle With Letter
Description: A floating bottle that you fished up accidentally. The cork on this bottle has already been damaged, and the letter within has been mildewed. Thankfully, you discovered it in time, or its contents may have become lost to time altogether.

Name: Onibudou
Description: A standalone volume from the light novel series "Onibudou," written by Junkichi, a writer with Yae Publishing House. This collection contains the first two major arcs in the story. The quality of the serialized version varies quite a bit, but it still enjoys a degree of popularity amongst readers.

Name: Grand Narukami Shrine Omamori
Description:
An omamori that served a critical purpose within the Plane of Euthymia.
According to Yae Miko, "This item was given to you by the lovely, sagacious Lady Yae Miko."

Name: Lucky Omamori
Description: An omamori that Thoma gave you. It is said to be able to bring good luck.

Name: Box of Nails
Description: A box of nails obtained from a Treasure Hoarder camp. You can use it for repairs.

Name: Planks
Description: Wooden planks obtained from a Treasure Hoarder camp. You can use them for repairs.

Name: Rope
Description: Rope obtained from a Treasure Hoarder camp. You can use it for repairs.

Name: Kito's Sachet
Description: A sachet carried by Kito and Kina. It seems to have been woven from two smaller sachets before being carefully hidden in a wooden box.

Name: Treasure Map Fragment
Description: A treasure map fragment left behind by Shitoki's brother. The vellum made from animal hide has the faint scent of sea-salt on it.

Name: Treasure Map Fragment
Description: A treasure map fragment left behind by Shitoki's brother. The vellum made from animal hide has the faint scent of sea-salt on it.

Name: Treasure Map Fragment
Description: A treasure map fragment left behind by Shitoki's brother. The vellum made from animal hide has the faint scent of sea-salt on it.

Name: Treasure Map Fragment
Description: A treasure map fragment left behind by Shitoki's brother. The vellum made from animal hide has the faint scent of sea-salt on it.

Name: A Treasure Map Left for Shitoki
Description: A complete Treasure Map made from several fragments. It gives off a faint sea-salt scent.

Name: Makiri's Charm
Description: A sturdy bag that seems seawater-proof. It's full of blessing from the ancestral spirits.

Name: General Purpose Directional Conduction Component
Description: A basic, common component often found in various creations of an ancient civilization, the function of which seems to be ensuring that these creations continue operating. Due to their close similarity in makeup to the components used in Pursina's Spikes, they can be used to replace its damaged parts. To think that Pursina's Spikes need such priceless objects to repair them... What a terrifyingly high-maintenance device.

Name: Rust-Worn Key
Description: A rusted key. Who knows how long it has been here...

Name: Heavy Key
Description: A key that feels heavy in your hand. What door will it open?

Name: Intact Key
Description: A key that at least looks intact. One wonders who might have left it here...

Name: Sumida's Letter
Description:
A letter given to you by Sumida.
Give this letter to Kama in Ritou.

Name: New Firework Model
Description: Yoimiya's new firework model. Who knows what it will do...

Name: New Chronicles of the Six Kitsune (V)
Description: Commentary regarding ancient matters that was specially added to the "New Chronicles of the Six Kitsune." If you find it an insipid, monotonous slog, dear reader, you may skip this volume. But as far as the author is concerned, this is one waste of words and emotion that cannot be avoided.

Name: Northland Bank Check
Description: A check with the emblem of the Northland Bank printed on it. It can be exchanged for Mora.

Name: Scrawled Treasure Map
Description: This is an awful specimen of a treasure map. Its lines are random and its grids scrawled. You could probably sell this for a significant amount of Mora by claiming that it is the work of some stream-of-consciousness artist, though.

Name: Kiminami Anna's Invigorating Kitty Meal
Description: An Invigorating Kitty Meal made personally by Kiminami Anna. You're not certain if Neko will like it or not...

Name: Autake Slate
Description:
An example of the Ishine Script that was once used on Tsurumi Island.
It probably needs to be returned to some place in the Autake Plains.

Name: General Purpose Directional Conduction Component
Description: A basic, common component often found in various creations of an ancient civilization, the function of which seems to be ensuring that these creations continue operating. Due to their close similarity in makeup to the components used in Pursina's Spikes, they can be used to replace its damaged parts. To think that Pursina's Spikes need such priceless objects to repair them... What a terrifyingly high-maintenance device.

Name: General Purpose Directional Conduction Component
Description: A basic, common component often found in various creations of an ancient civilization, the function of which seems to be ensuring that these creations continue operating. Due to their close similarity in makeup to the components used in Pursina's Spikes, they can be used to replace its damaged parts. To think that Pursina's Spikes need such priceless objects to repair them... What a terrifyingly high-maintenance device.

Name: General Purpose Directional Conduction Component
Description: A basic, common component often found in various creations of an ancient civilization, the function of which seems to be ensuring that these creations continue operating. Due to their close similarity in makeup to the components used in Pursina's Spikes, they can be used to replace its damaged parts. To think that Pursina's Spikes need such priceless objects to repair them... What a terrifyingly high-maintenance device.

Name: A Preliminary Study of Sangonomiya Folk Belief
Description: This paper was written by Shihab Purbiruni, a scholar of modern history from Sumeru, two years before the civil war in Inazuma. It details the folk beliefs of Watatsumi Island and the Sangonomiya people, and puts forward some relatively new academic propositions.

Name: The Life of Mouun the Shrine Maiden
Description: For the people of Watatsumi, the legends of the Archon War are always filled with bitterness. Many of these millennia-old folksongs tell of a shrine maiden by the name of Mouun, who once rode upon the back of a sea monster, following the Great Serpent unto a tragic, moving end.

Name: Debates on the "Viceroy of the East"
Description: The "Viceroy of the East," or "Touzannou" sung of in Watatsumi folk tradition is also known as the "Akuou" all across Raiden's domains. He was the first vassal ruler of the Great Serpent Orobashi, and he was also the last.

Name: Treasured Tales of the Chouken Shinkageuchi (I)
Description: The first part of a traditional Inazuman novel. This particular volume is also known as "Shinkageuchi," and was once a restricted text. It contains a fantastical tale about the first Raiden Shogun and her kagemusha, depicting the benevolent sagacity of the first Shogun and the great valor of her kagemusha. However, due to the great popularity of another book known colloquially as "Raiden Reincarnation," many people became interested in stories of this kind. This book thus wound up being published in a haphazard manner.

Name: Mysterious Stone
Description:
This object seems to carry the Ishine Script that was once used on Tsurumi Island.
Bring this stone back to its rightful place.

Name: Diary of Roald the Adventurer: Tsurumi Island
Description: A diary left behind by the famed adventurer, Roald. The pages bear both the moist smell of the fog and a certain fungal scent.

Name: Fresh Meat
Description: Food that Thoma has prepared for the stray cats and dogs. This should go like hotcakes.

Name: Fresh Fish
Description: Food that Thoma has prepared for the stray cats and dogs. A slightly fishy smell wafts off it.

Name: Bag of Retrieved Items
Description: A batch of abandoned goods that you found at a warehouse at the south wharf. They essentially have no value.

Name: Repaired Comb
Description: The comb that Ningguang commissioned Mingxing Jewelry to repair. It belongs to a special informant. The damage to the comb was originally quite severe. The fact that it could be repaired to this extent is quite impressive indeed.

Name: Mysterious Flyer
Description: A pamphlet you obtained from the Ms. Hina Fan Club. You've got to say that the design looks kind of familiar...

Name: Rigorous Schedule
Description: A schedule that you created for Ningguang. The various items are all laid out in a clear and easy-to-read manner.

Name: Simple Schedule
Description: A schedule that you created for Ningguang. Simple, cogent, and to the point.

Name: Starsplinter Iron
Description: One of the ores required to create Wonder Cores. It has the power to resonate with Visions.

Name: Subrosium
Description: One of the ores required to create Wonder Cores. It can often be found where dawn meets dusk.

Name: Wonder Core
Description: The core component to the Jade Chamber's mechanisms. When combined with Adepti Sigils, they can be used as the control center of the Jade Chamber.

Name: Adepti Sigil
Description: Adepti Sigils made by Shenhe. They contain dense adeptal energy.

Name: Records of a Changing Village
Description: Documents announcing the villagers' migration. It states that the village was forced to relocate due to a god's remains.

Name: Ragged Notebook
Description: A ragged notebook you found in the village. It records the happenings of long ago, now buried by the passage of time.

Name: Mountainous Miscellany
Description: This text contains all manner of strange legends about Mt. Tianheng's stones, including tales about many rare ores. It is said that if you stand in the middle of the lake south of Mt. Tianheng at dusk, you will find the legendary Subrosium.

Name: Neatly-Written Note
Description: The paper of this letter is slightly brittle and its ink is also a little smudged. It seems that both it and its owner have borne the assault of the waves. Unfortunately, while they encountered the same tribulations, they did not share the same fate.

Name: Little Meng's Drifting Bottle
Description: A bottle containing Little Meng's various troubles. You wonder what's inside...

Name: Lumenstone
Description:
A special stone mined from the depths of The Chasm. It is said that it has catalytic properties.
It almost blazes with light in the gloomy mines, but it loses all such effects the moment one leaves The Chasm.
It seems to have other unique properties as well that have yet to be discovered.

Name: Muning's Note
Description: The Ministry representative Muning gave you this note. Despite its short length, the word "prohibited" appears 8 times. If you give this to an adventurer named Zhiqiong, you will receive the aid you need.

Name: Treasure Map Fragment
Description:
A fragment of a larger map that seems to indicate the location of treasure.
If you can find the other fragment, that should complete the picture.

Name: Treasure Hoarders' Treasure Map
Description:
This treasure map, once torn in two and kept in different hiding spots by the Treasure Hoarders, is now whole again.
If you follow the symbol on it, you might discover some special treasure!

Name: Storehouse Security Key No. 1
Description: A key to a certain storehouse that was hidden in a very obvious place, yet was never found by the Treasure Hoarders. Guess they're not as good at their job as they think, huh?

Name: Storehouse Security Key No. 2
Description: A key to a certain storehouse that was hidden in an incredibly obvious place, yet was never found by the Treasure Hoarders. They should probably go back to Hoarder school.

Name: A Set of Cannonballs
Description:
Cannonballs for the Mountainator, also known as the Safe Blasting Mechanism 2156. Although you used the Lumenstone Adjuvant to clear the unknown pollutants away, there is still a stench about them that can be detected even while covering your nose.
Ugh. Do you really have to touch it?

Name: Special Unmoving Essential Oil
Description:
A dangerous substance made using the formula that Clitopho provided by compressing two Unmoving Essential Oils into one very dense bottle filled with Geo elemental energy.
Due to its fame as a highly unstable concoction, only madmen or experienced miners would dare use it, making it an uncommon sight indeed.
Handle with utmost care!

Name: Key to a Stony Hall
Description: According to Khedive's initial speculations, this construct may be a "key" that could open the door to some ruin somewhere.

Name: Photo of a Strange Rock
Description: You took this picture of a strange rock that can be seen on the walls of The Chasm. You do not know what the patterns on the rock mean, but perhaps it could be of value to some researchers.

Name: Akademiya Recommendation Letter
Description:
This letter, carefully crafted, and it is sealed in the name of "Ecologist Khedive Pursina."
You got this as a gift from Khedive. He claims that this is even more precious than gold, and can gain you the help of the House of Purbiruni.
Khedive himself believes monetary remuneration to be something of an insult... Hopefully, this doesn't prove to be a trend with people from Sumeru.

Name: Orb of the Blue Depths
Description: A strange gem left behind by a foe from the Abyss. If you look into it hard, it is almost as if you are looking into a long-borne dream shrouded by a deep fog.

Name: Metal Key
Description: A key wrought of metal that has been worn down with rust accumulated over many years.

Name: Miner's Key
Description: Such keys are commonly found in the mines, but one wonders why it would appear here.

Name: Blessings of Wisdom
Description: A suspicious object you obtained from Xamaran. It is claimed that this can clear the source of the foul energy. Condensed from the fungus' absorbed nutrients, the agglomeration of spores... and a thick sense of humor.

Name: Mountainator Cannonball (Fuse Attached)
Description: A cannonball with a fuse carefully attached. Ready to be fired at any time!

Name: Toy Doll
Description: A toy belonging to miner Qi Ding's daughter. It looks pretty tattered and it's hard to imagine that any kid would like it. But the intricate stitch-work shows that this was once quite the pricey item.

Name: Flower of Farsight
Description:
One of the six lost offerings scattered throughout The Chasm... possibly? It seems just like an ordinary Qingxin, and one that has newly sprouted as well, seeing as how its white petals have never been touched by dew.
Who knows how many people have once climbed up to high heights to pick one such fresh flower? Who knows if these flowers eventually bore witness to partings or reunions?

Name: Skyfeather
Description:
One of the six lost offerings scattered throughout The Chasm, a feather that fell from an eagle that flew over the top of the cavern. The Millelith seem to enjoy collecting these tough feathers to use as ornaments.
It is said that eagle feathers fit valiant warriors best, and so tend to be used to decorate the armor and arms of the bravest, such that they might break the enemy formation with all the swiftness of that great bird of prey.

Name: Sundial of Ages
Description:
One of the six lost offerings scattered throughout The Chasm. It seems quite old now, but the etchings are still very clear, and so it can still be used.
The sun is a rare sight down in The Chasm, and it is easy to lose track of time. But someday, this sundial will once again track the passage of years.

Name: Cup of Commons
Description:
One of the six lost offerings scattered throughout The Chasm. Neither stone nor gem, it somehow still became part of the Treasure Hoarders' loot hoard.
It has been filled by turns with fine wine, fair treasure, and blood. Now, its previous shame has been washed away, and it is ready to take on new memories.

Name: Helm of Warding
Description:
One of the six lost offerings scattered throughout The Chasm. It was found hidden in the living quarters of the miners. A slightly less discerning eye might have mistaken it for a miner's hat.
It is heavily scarred and pitted, making one wonder how many miners' lives it must have saved.

Name: Warrior's Spear
Description:
One of the six lost offerings scattered throughout The Chasm. It was lost amid the ancient battlefield five hundred years ago. The long years have worn the edge of the spear-point away, but it still looks quite ominous nonetheless.
One can imagine that it was once wielded by a warrior most brave, earning the cheers of the young wherever it swept, even unto The Chasm itself.

Name: Brass Ring
Description: A ring that you got off a Golden Weasel Thief. See how it glitters, see how it shines! The Weasel Thief must have planned on using it to attract a mate, and it does indeed look quite valuable. One imagines that its owner must be quite distressed at the moment.

Name: Archaic Stone
Description:
A strange, rare ore that was mined from The Chasm.
These rocks can only be found in the ore veins of the oldest mountains. It is so rare that most merchants have probably never heard of it.
However, the changes in The Chasm have led to the emergence of much low-quality Archaic Stone, a fact that has given the merchants of Huishan Hall quite the headache.

Name: Shriveled Seed
Description:
A seemingly withered object that seems to, by normal judgment, be a seed. However, it still has a surprising amount of life in it yet.
Best not to eat it for now...

Name: Lumenstone Ore
Description: The raw ore from which Lumenstone may be found. If processed properly, it can be used to strengthen the Lumenstone Adjuvant you have. Why not hit Jinwu up and ask her?

Name: Yue Chuan's Drifting Bottle
Description: A drifting bottle that contains Yue Chuan's reply to Little Meng. You wonder if it'll reach him...

Name: Hiraizumi's Goods
Description: Fresh soy milk. It'll go bad quick if improperly stored.

Name: Cell Key
Description: A metal key that you obtained from the Fatui. It should be able to open some kind of door.

Name: Freshly-Picked Calla Lily
Description: A freshly-picked Calla Lily. Suitable for being used as a specimen.

Name: Freshly-Picked Small Lamp Grass
Description: A freshly-picked Small Lamp Grass. Suitable for being used as a specimen.

Name: Freshly-Picked Cecilia
Description: A freshly-picked Cecilia with a pleasant fragrance.

Name: Ruin Machine Core
Description: The core section of a Ruin Guard. Old and new versions of this device are incompatible, and it thus cannot be used to empower other objects. However, the leftover energy should be enough to power one Ruin Guard.

Name: Date's Key
Description: Date's key. Unfortunately, this will not open the treasury of a distinguished Enkanomiya family. It will only open the way to the Heterodoxa labyrinth.

Name: Pile of Lavender Melons
Description: This pile of Lavender Melons may have been collected and placed here by some kind of animal. They look a bit like Onikabuto from a distance.

Name: Fine Incense
Description: Incense you got from Wang Ping'an. Looks to be of good quality.

Name: Curious Cube
Description: An unknown construct that you discovered in the depths of The Chasm. It resembles an intricately-made cube.

Name: A Note Someone Stuffed You
Description: As you were walking down the streets of Inazuma, someone stuffed this note onto your person. Two strange symbols are drawn on it.

Name: Special Bamboo Slip
Description: A Bamboo Slip upon which Momoyo has applied some specially made elemental powder. Store and handle it with care! The powder has some measure of poison in it — and of course, you'll get yelled at for improper handling.

Name: "Final Instructions"
Description: Fatui operational orders that you obtained from Lyudochka. They detail an operation that will take place in the future on Watatsumi Island. This intelligence is very important — peoples' lives are at stake here!

Name: Bag of Clothes
Description: A bag that contains Lyudochka's Fatui uniform. Considering the controversial nature of Fatui uniforms, it is best not to let other people see this.

Name: Special Fortune Slip
Description:
A specially made fortune slip that describes how your luck will be like today. There is nothing different about this Fortune Slip, save for the fact that you got it for the fake Bamboo Slip.
Whose fortune does this Fortune Slip describe?

Name: Strange Object
Description: A strange item that you fished up from the underground waterways in The Chasm. It's wet, and you cannot tell if this is a living or dead thing.

Name: Bedrock Key Location Diagram
Description: A simple diagram that Zhiqiong drew in haste. It indicates the general locations of several Bedrock Keys.

Name: Light Mora Purse
Description: A Mora purse you found in a treasure chest. The feeling you had when weighing it was one of immense disappointment.

Name: Full Mora Purse
Description: A Mora purse you found in a treasure chest. Compared to the previous purse you found, this one provides a decent amount more comfort.

Name: Plump Fish
Description: A fish you just obtained from the river. It might be considered a gift from nature. It is so excellent that it only needs to be grilled a little to be delicious as can be.

Name: Beautifully-Written Note
Description: Beautifully-Written Note

Name: Yun Jin's Personal Letter
Description: A letter that Yun Jin personally wrote to Shiyun. It seems to hold the key to turning the situation around.

Name: Lyudochka's Letter
Description:
The letter that Lyudochka asked someone from Yae Publishing House to pass on to you. It contains her reasons for leaving without saying why. However, whether you will accept her reasons for departing or not is a different story.
It was you who discovered her presence and changed her fate... Might you be able to do still more to change this ending for the better?

Name: Lyudochka's Mora Purse
Description: The Mora purse that Lyudochka left behind. It contains a decent sum of Mora, but even Paimon doesn't want to use it.

Name: Fatui Code Sheet
Description:
A certain ever-somnolent member of the Shuumatsuban wrote this Fatui Code Sheet.
Reading it does not merely let you know that "these Fatui speak very oddly indeed" — you can also feel the recorder's intense lethargy penetrating the paper in the form of saliva.

Name: Light Purse
Description: A purse you got from Mona. It contains the amount she needs to pay her rent.

Name: Marjorie's Gift
Description: A present that you got from Marjorie. You've heard that children will like it...

Name: Viktor's Gift
Description: A gift you got from Viktor. He seems to have also put a letter under the gift box.

Name: Fresh Wolfhooks
Description: Fresh Wolfhooks that Schuster picked. Thankfully, they haven't been damaged by monsters yet.

Name: Lyudochka's Fortune Slip
Description:
A specially made fortune slip that describes how your luck will be like today. There is nothing different about this Fortune Slip, save for the fact that you used it to open Lyudochka's heart.
Now, this Fortune Slip has returned to your hands, along with her heartfelt blessings. If you've got the time, why not go to the Grand Narukami Shrine to see her?

Name: The Serpent and Drakes of Tokoyokoku
Description: A novel based on Watatsumi Island's folktales. The original edition of this text was transcribed on Watatsumi Island and brought back to Narukami Island by a merchant while the former's serpent god yet lived. No one reads this ancient tome nowadays, its role supplanted by all the light novels on the market. This book describes the unique cosmological outlook of the Watatsumi people before they came to adopt aspects of Narukami culture, and a recent resurgence in traditional novel publishing has allowed it to see the light of day once more.

Name: Before Sun and Moon
Description: A chronicle that ordinary folk have been forbidden to read. The writing is a mix of fables and histories from the beginning of the world to the creation of the Dainichi Mikoshi.

Name: Hydrological Studies in Byakuyakoku
Description: This text records the geography and hydrology of Byakuyakoku. With the sealing of the depths and the emigration of the people of Watatsumi, as well as the passing of long years, this book is now useless.

Name: Bathysmal Vishap Experimental Records
Description: Experimental Records of the Bathysmal Vishaps. No vishaps were killed in the writing of these records.

Name: In the Light, Beneath the Shadow
Description: A puzzle book for children of ages nine to twelve. As a book from a transitory period, it uses Narukami-style names with Byakuyakoku subscripts.

Name: The Miraculous Adventures of the Traveler
Description: "This is a rather orthodox light novel, with its contents essentially being an edited version of real life in Teyvat. What is surprising, however, is that the author seems to be highly knowledgeable about Watatsumi Island, with many vivid, almost lifelike descriptions." — Ms. Hina

Name: The Miraculous Adventures of the Traveler
Description: "This light novel is based on school life and depicts the antics of all manner of schoolyard oddballs. A very entertaining read." — Ms. Hina

Name: The Miraculous Adventures of the Traveler
Description: "This story is quite wild and can be almost disorienting to read initially, but its wonderment grows on you, and it contains many a moment of gut-busting laughter. I liked it very much." — Ms. Hina

Name: The Miraculous Adventures of the Traveler
Description: "By blending many styles together, this seemingly thin book transports you into a great many tales. I can only imagine that its author must also be a very interesting person. I happen to know someone like that, in fact — something that lends this book a very familiar touch." — Ms. Hina

Name: Muning's Note
Description: The Ministry representative Muning gave you this note. Despite its short length, the word "prohibited" appears 8 times. If you give this to an adventurer named Zhiqiong, you will receive the aid you need.

Name: Frostglaze Crystal
Description:
A glaze crystal produced in the depths of The Chasm, this special Glaze Sand Crystal ore was one of many scattered about during the battle against the giant ruin machine. Glaze Sand Crystal ore is a regional specialty of The Chasm, but this one is different from the rest.
Under the radiance of the blue crystal and the power of the Abyss, a strange spiral pattern has emerged within this stone, and it is cold, almost chilling to the touch.
This once smooth crystal has been transformed into this shape by the great might that descended from the heavens and the miasma that arose from the earth's depths — and perhaps the form it has taken is itself a warning unto mortals.
If the interaction of these forces alone could twist stone and metal thus, if that ordinary heroine was truly able to witness the end of the pitch-dark path, how would she have faced the discovery she would make?

Name: Light Realm Sigil
Description:
A mark symbolizing the recognition of Enkanomiya's Tokoyo Ookami.
They can be offered up to the Statue of the Vassals of Watatsumi, thus upgrading the Bokuso Box.

Name: Light Realm Core
Description:
You discovered this mysterious stone while exploring the darkened realm of Enkanomiya.
The Light Realm gave humans additional means to resist the Abyss.

Name: Bloodied Sergeant's Insignia
Description: The bloodied and muddied insignia of a Fatui sergeant. You have no idea how it ended up in the depths of The Chasm.

Name: Corporal Nikolay's Diary
Description: A letter left behind by Corporal Nikolay. Its contents have long ceased to be whole.

Name: Corporal Nikolay's Diary
Description: A fragment of Fatui Corporal Nikolay's diary. It gives off a rather unpleasant smell, but that's at least better than being covered in mud.

Name: Mora Purse
Description: You were asked by Xu from Feiyun Commerce Guild to deliver this to Huishan Hall's representative Muning, who is at The Chasm. It contains a rather sizable sum of Mora.

Name: A Firsthand Guide to Summoning Spirits
Description: A light novel that has been popular in Inazuma lately. It contains all manner of bizarre tales involving ancient youkai.

Name: Dream Sakura
Description:
You held a single sakura petal in your hand before leaving Raiden Makoto's realm of consciousness.
Its existence is a mystery. It appears no different from ordinary sakura petals, and there it silently sits in your storage just like any of the others. But you can no longer touch it, nor can you feel its weight or warmth. When an object loses any of the attributes that one would normally ascribe to it, how can its "existence" be proven for sure?
As you think back on the many sights the petal must have witnessed in the past, a certain guess comes to mind: that which sustains this sakura petal's existence must be someone's will. But as to who this person is, and whether they are intentionally or unintentionally keeping this petal in existence, neither can be known. Nor can you prove whether that willpower is one derived from yearning, trust, or gratitude.
Perhaps, when "that person's will" changes, so too will this sakura petal disappear.
Just to be safe, it might be best to check back from time to time and see if it still exists.

Name: Aphotium Ore
Description: A special ore created due to the Watatsumi Goryou Matsuri. As Enkanomiya's environment has undergone extreme changes, the memories and thoughts of Watatsumi Omikami scattered throughout Enkanomiya have coalesced into medullae, which then transformed into ore.

Name: Tokoyo Legume
Description: A special plant that was produced via the Watatsumi Goryou Matsuri. With the awakening of the Sangacorexes, the elemental energies within Enkanomiya have been pacified. This is a naturally-growing fertilizing crop that will turn into loam within the soil once it decays.

Name: Husk Gem
Description: A jewel that fell from the armor of a special Shadowy Husk after you defeated it. You can feel a will surging within it. Perhaps it might be more correct to say that this will manifested itself through the armor rather than manipulated it.

Name: Fragmented Accessory
Description: A small accessory you got from Kokomi. It seems to be the fragment of another object. According to her, it might come in handy at some point.

Name: Fragmented Accessory
Description: A fragment that you got from "Enjou." He stole this from the Dainichi Mikoshi, so this should be a relic of Enkanomiya.

Name: Tsumi's Map
Description: A map drawn by Tsumi. There are some markings on it.

Name: Hakuen Michimitsu Amenoma
Description:
The heirloom blade of the Iwakura Clan.
Although the one who forged this blade possessed great skills, and though it is true that this sword has slain many a foe, it does not possess any special powers. Nor has the Iwakura Succession ever obtained a Vision. Their excellent swordsmanship was purely a result of their honing of mind, body, and technique.
This blade has been submerged in water for a long time and seems to have completely rusted.

Name: Wooden Cage Key
Description: Someone from the Kanjou Commission left this behind. You should be able to use this to rescue Shinnojou.

Name: Damaged Stone Slate
Description: A seemingly ordinary stone slate. Who knows what secrets it might hold...

Name: Mysterious Stone Slate
Description: The final stone slate you obtained. Secrets within secrets, eh?

Name: Yanbo's Note
Description: A somewhat complete note, written in a neat hand. It seems to have been a letter left for an old friend.

Name: Nikolay's Letter
Description: A letter you found off one of the Black Serpent Knights. The name of the letter's recipient is neatly written: "Katarina Snezhevna, My Dear Elder Sister," while the sender's name is written somewhat haphazardly, though you can make out the words "Your Brother, Nikolay Snezhevich."

Name: Fragrant Seasoning
Description: Seasoning created using the recipe given to you by Nazafarin. It has a tangy aroma and serves to bring out the flavor in any dish it is added to.

Name: Fragrant Vegetarian Abalone
Description: A delicious dish with some extra seasoning! It gives off a titillating aroma... But whose tastes will this dish suit? Invite your friends, invite your pals — get them to try this new dish!

Name: The Almighty Arataki Great and Glorious Drumalong Festival!
Description: This is a most lavish invitation letter, whether in its construction or its content. The letter describes a large-scale, deep-rooted, nationally-acclaimed event in which you shall be a most important guest, the radiant star of the show.

Name: Worksite Records
Description: This was originally a ledger, but appears to have been re-purposed as a site log instead. The latest daily happenings at The Chasm have been scribbled into its pages, though not much of this information is of any particular use.

Name: Fragrant Mint Salad
Description: A delicious dish with some extra seasoning! It gives off a titillating aroma... But whose tastes will this dish suit? Invite your friends, invite your pals — get them to try this new dish!

Name: Fragrant Triple-Layered Consommé
Description: A delicious dish with some extra seasoning! It gives off a titillating aroma... But whose tastes will this dish suit? Invite your friends, invite your pals — get them to try this new dish!

Name: Zhiqiong's Letter
Description: A letter left by a young adventurer. There is a slightly bitter scent of Qingxin on this piece of paper.

Name: Arrival Schedule
Description:
A list of guests and their time of arrival on ships bound for the Irodori Festival.
Your task is to welcome and lend your aid to guests according to the information presented in this schedule.

Name: Five Kasen Summary
Description:
A summary of the information concerning the Five Kasen, which you got from Yae Publishing House's Hirayama.
Although the content is quite sparse, you can still get the gist of the Five Kasen and the great flair they had in their heyday.

Name: The Five Kasen's Splendor: Suikou
Description: A sheet of paper Venti found in a cargo crate within the wharf warehouse. A poem entitled "The Five Kasen's Splendor: Suikou" is written upon it.

Name: The Five Kasen's Splendor: Aoi no Okina
Description: A sheet of paper Xingqiu found beneath his luggage. Someone seems to have left it there while he was napping. A poem entitled "The Five Kasen's Splendor: Aoi no Okina" is written upon it.

Name: The Five Kasen's Splendor: Akahito
Description: A sheet of paper that some mysterious person left behind. This person must have originally intended to leave it on Kazuha's person, only to be unexpectedly detected by the latter and forced to flee in a hurry, leaving the sheet behind. A poem entitled "The Five Kasen's Splendor: Akahito" is written upon it.

Name: The Five Kasen's Splendor: Sumizome
Description: Ayaka found this on a flower stand at the festival venue. This sheet of paper, however, only contains one line of text.

Name: The Five Kasen's Splendor: Sumizome
Description: Ayaka found this on a flower stand at the festival venue. Once submerged in water, this sheet of paper reveals the full poetic text of "The Five Kasen's Splendor: Sumizome."

Name: Ancient Forging Blueprint
Description:
An ancient forging blueprint. The Shogun once ordered the Kaedehara Clan to forge a Goshintou according to it.
After being soaked in water, it becomes clear that some of the text has been blurred — someone tampered with the blueprint, dooming the forging to failure and triggering the tragedy that followed...

Name: Kaedehara Yoshinori's Letter
Description:
A blank piece of paper that was hidden in an old flower pot. When dipped in water, it reveals a long-sealed secret.
After telling everyone about the truth that was concealed within, Kazuha said that "this letter may still be of use to you," before handing it over to you.

Name: Taliesin's Manuscript
Description: A very thick poetic manuscript. If you were to give it a generous review, it would be "mediocre," while an honest review would see it getting a "hard to read." It resembles bone-dry historical records more than it does poetry.

Name: Fragrant Stir-Fried Shrimp
Description: A delicious dish with some extra seasoning! It gives off a titillating aroma... But whose tastes will this dish suit? Invite your friends, invite your pals — get them to try this new dish!

Name: Fragrant Golden Shrimp Balls
Description: A delicious dish with some extra seasoning! It gives off a titillating aroma... But whose tastes will this dish suit? Invite your friends, invite your pals — get them to try this new dish!

Name: Fragrant Qingce Stir Fry
Description: A delicious dish with some extra seasoning! It gives off a titillating aroma... But whose tastes will this dish suit? Invite your friends, invite your pals — get them to try this new dish!

Name: Fragrant Black-Back Perch Stew
Description: A delicious dish with some extra seasoning! It gives off a titillating aroma... But whose tastes will this dish suit? Invite your friends, invite your pals — get them to try this new dish!

Name: Fragrant Stir-Fried Filet
Description: A delicious dish with some extra seasoning! It gives off a titillating aroma... But whose tastes will this dish suit? Invite your friends, invite your pals — get them to try this new dish!

Name: Fragrant Grilled Tiger Fish
Description: A delicious dish with some extra seasoning! It gives off a titillating aroma... But whose tastes will this dish suit? Invite your friends, invite your pals — get them to try this new dish!

Name: Fragrant Crab Roe Tofu
Description: A delicious dish with some extra seasoning! It gives off a titillating aroma... But whose tastes will this dish suit? Invite your friends, invite your pals — get them to try this new dish!

Name: Fragrant Golden Crab
Description: A delicious dish with some extra seasoning! It gives off a titillating aroma... But whose tastes will this dish suit? Invite your friends, invite your pals — get them to try this new dish!

Name: Fragrant Jewelry Soup
Description: A delicious dish with some extra seasoning! It gives off a titillating aroma... But whose tastes will this dish suit? Invite your friends, invite your pals — get them to try this new dish!

Name: Fragrant Bamboo Shoot Soup
Description: A delicious dish with some extra seasoning! It gives off a titillating aroma... But whose tastes will this dish suit? Invite your friends, invite your pals — get them to try this new dish!

Name: Fragrant Noodles with Mountain Delicacies
Description: A delicious dish with some extra seasoning! It gives off a titillating aroma... But whose tastes will this dish suit? Invite your friends, invite your pals — get them to try this new dish!

Name: Fragrant Mora Meat
Description: A delicious dish with some extra seasoning! It gives off a titillating aroma... But whose tastes will this dish suit? Invite your friends, invite your pals — get them to try this new dish!

Name: Fragrant Stir-Fried Fish Noodles
Description: A delicious dish with some extra seasoning! It gives off a titillating aroma... But whose tastes will this dish suit? Invite your friends, invite your pals — get them to try this new dish!

Name: Fragrant Universal Peace
Description: A delicious dish with some extra seasoning! It gives off a titillating aroma... But whose tastes will this dish suit? Invite your friends, invite your pals — get them to try this new dish!

Name: Fragrant Rice Buns
Description: A delicious dish with some extra seasoning! It gives off a titillating aroma... But whose tastes will this dish suit? Invite your friends, invite your pals — get them to try this new dish!

Name: Fragrant Almond Tofu
Description: A delicious dish with some extra seasoning! It gives off a titillating aroma... But whose tastes will this dish suit? Invite your friends, invite your pals — get them to try this new dish!

Name: Fragrant Lotus Flower Crisp
Description: A delicious dish with some extra seasoning! It gives off a titillating aroma... But whose tastes will this dish suit? Invite your friends, invite your pals — get them to try this new dish!

Name: Sayu's Salary
Description: This was originally intended to buy bedding and other materials by which sleep quality might be improved, but on the other hand, Sayu has no wish to sleep forever just yet.

Name: Statue of Her Excellency, the Almighty Narukami Ogosho, God of Thunder
Description: The Statue of Her Excellency, the Almighty Narukami Ogosho, God of Thunder that Sara has been hankering after. Go on, go give it to her.

Name: Kokomi's Shopping List
Description: A shopping list of books compiled by Kokomi. All the genres, unit prices, and amounts of the books she desires have been written down here in her elegant script.

Name: Toy Fox
Description:
The gift that Gorou got when helping Kokomi purchase books during the Irodori Festival. Gorou then gave it to you as thanks for accompanying him.
Every time you look at it, you can't help but remember the sight of every hair on Gorou's body standing on end as he heard the word "fox."

Name: Salary Bag
Description: It is said that opening this will bring you bad luck. It seems lighter than you assumed it might be...?

Name: A Complete Chart of Ako's Treasure
Description: A complete nautical chart pieced together after all four parts of the clue were collected, leading to the treasure hidden by Ako Domeki and company before they left this place.

Name: "Outlander Brigade: When the Wind of Death Blew Towards the Blond Samurai" Script
Description: A "film script" you obtained from Xavier.

Name: "Mushounin" Script
Description:
A new film script that Xavier finished overnight, much thicker than his last one. What you have here merely contains Act I.
The willpower one can harness to achieve a goal is truly amazing.

Name: A Legend of Sword (VI)
Description: "In essence, the great battle in space is no different from the armed conflict between commoners which took place ten years ago on that barren planet..." Soon, the name of that man shall be known across the Galaxy, matching that of the Emperor.

Name: Shogun Almighty: Reborn as Raiden With Unlimited Power
Description: A popular light novel in Inazuma which tells the story of a mere mortal suddenly turning into the Raiden Shogun. The story is well-received for its novel plot and has inspired many light novelists.

Name: Pretty Please, Kitsune Guuji?
Description: A popular light novel in Inazuma which tells the story of the "good-for-nothing" Shogun and the "good-at-everything" Kitsune Guuji. The novel is in the same collection as "Shogun Almighty: Reborn as Raiden With Unlimited Power," but not by the same author. What they share in common, however, is their popularity.

Name: Let's Go, Dodoco!
Description: Message From the Editor: "Let's Go, Dodoco!" is the combined work of an older girl and a younger girl. Every chapter brims with their gentleness and good wishes, as the story is intended as a gift to our readers. I hope this book — in spite of its small volume — can bring you some simple joy after a long day of work.

Name: Let's Go, Dodoco!
Description: Message From the Editor: "Let's Go, Dodoco!" is the combined work of an older girl and a younger girl. Every chapter brims with their gentleness and good wishes, as the story is intended as a gift to our readers. I hope this book — in spite of its small volume — can bring you some simple joy after a long day of work.

Name: Ako's Treasure: Location 1
Description: Before Ako Domeki and company left, they had hidden a treasure here and agreed to unearth it when they met in the archipelago again. The secret of where the treasure is was split into four parts, and this is the first part.

Name: Ako's Treasure: Location 2
Description: Before Ako Domeki and company left, they had hidden a treasure here and agreed to unearth it when they met in the archipelago again. The secret of where the treasure is was split into four parts, and this is the second part.

Name: Ako's Treasure: Location 3
Description: Before Ako Domeki and company left, they had hidden a treasure here and agreed to unearth it when they met in the archipelago again. The secret of where the treasure is was split into four parts, and this is the third part.

Name: Ako's Treasure: Location 4
Description: Before Ako Domeki and company left, they had hidden a treasure here and agreed to unearth it when they met in the archipelago again. The secret of where the treasure is was split into four parts, and this is the fourth part.

Name: Yajna Grass
Description: One of the ingredients for making the elixir Arahaoma. "Yajna" is said to mean "the realization of death."

Name: Zohrah Mushroom
Description: One of the ingredients for making the elixir Arahaoma. "Zohrah" is said to mean "lost in a tipsy dream."

Name: Barsam Flower
Description: One of the ingredients for making the elixir Arahaoma. "Barsam" is said to be a sacred tree that has long vanished in history.

Name: Arahaoma
Description: An elixir of Aranara. A mere drop of it is all it takes to unveil Aranara's pure and pristine dreams to the forest.

Name: "Mushounin" Script
Description:
A new film script that Xavier finished overnight, much thicker than his last one. What you have here merely contains Acts I and II.
The willpower one can harness to achieve a goal is truly amazing.

Name: "Mushounin" Script
Description:
A new film script that Xavier finished overnight, much thicker than his last one.
The willpower one can harness to achieve a goal is truly amazing.

Name: Jinwu's Soup
Description:
A thick soup that Jinwu made for sick miners. It's nutritious, fragrant, and makes you feel warm inside when you drink it.
Don't let it go cold, now.

Name: Bag of Ornaments
Description: A bag of decorations that Old Chou gave you as compensation for Tang Wuchou's misfortunes. They are very roughly made, owing to having been manufactured by the Treasure Hoarders within The Chasm using smuggled ore, and can barely be considered to possess any aesthetic qualities at all. As such, there is no hope at all of them selling well in Liyue. The only thing good you could say about these ornaments is that they are at least made using the right materials...

Name: Vasmrti
Description: An item you obtained after traversing the nursery. It is translucent and seems to contain the memories of the earth.

Name: Sea Route Log
Description: A log indicating how to find the clues, left by the ones who hid them. If you navigate as it directs, you may indeed find a clue regarding the treasure left by Ako Domeki and company.

Name: Route Log: I
Description: A log indicating how to find the clues, left by the ones who hid them. If you proceed as it directs, you may indeed find a clue regarding the treasure left by Ako Domeki and company.

Name: Route Log: II
Description: A log indicating how to find the clues, left by the ones who hid them. If you proceed as it directs, you may indeed find a clue regarding the treasure left by Ako Domeki and company. Still, this is, what, the second log you've found already? Hopefully, it can lead you directly to the clue this time.

Name: Asterism Shard
Description: A mysterious shard engraved with a pattern of stars. It seems to be the key to solving a certain mechanism puzzle somewhere.

Name: Asterism Shard
Description: A mysterious shard engraved with a pattern of stars. It seems to be the key to solving a certain mechanism puzzle somewhere.

Name: Asterism Shard
Description: A mysterious shard engraved with a pattern of stars. It seems to be the key to solving a certain mechanism puzzle somewhere.

Name: Asterism Shard
Description: A mysterious shard engraved with a pattern of stars. It seems to be the key to solving a certain mechanism puzzle somewhere.

Name: Asterism Shard
Description: A mysterious shard engraved with a pattern of stars. It seems to be the key to solving a certain mechanism puzzle somewhere.

Name: Asterism Shard
Description: A mysterious shard engraved with a pattern of stars. It seems to be the key to solving a certain mechanism puzzle somewhere.

Name: Asterism Shard
Description: A mysterious shard engraved with a pattern of stars. It seems to be the key to solving a certain mechanism puzzle somewhere.

Name: Asterism Shard
Description: A mysterious shard engraved with a pattern of stars. It seems to be the key to solving a certain mechanism puzzle somewhere.

Name: Vasoma Fruit
Description:
A fruit with mysterious powers.
Bija is indispensable for helping Rana, and the Vasoma Fruit is indispensable for obtaining Bija.

Name: Garland
Description:
A garland woven by Arama.
Garlands of this kind represent the blessings from all of Vanarana and once channeled endless powers during the fight with Marana's Avatar. But their blazing light has now faded, perhaps because they burned so relentlessly.

Every flower on the garland is connected with the lovely, tiny heart of an Aranara, and all of them together constitute the gate to Mahavanaranapna. Aranara will support those who wear such garlands. As friends, they ease the wearers' pains, ward off their nightmares, aid them through lightless days, and fill the emptiness in their hearts.

Name: Garland
Description:
A garland woven by Arama.
Garlands of this kind represent the blessings from all of Vanarana.

Name: Bija
Description: The crystallization of what is most precious to Aranara. It is not only a fruit but also a seed of hope.

Name: Arana's Flower
Description:
A flower gifted to you by Arana.
You promised Arana that the evil shall be punished.

Name: Araja's Flower
Description:
A flower gifted to you by Araja.
Araja seems to have lost important memories.

Name: Nameless Flower
Description:
A flower gifted to you by an unknown Aranara.
A symbol of Aranara friendship. One who receives this flower willingly recognizes this friendship.

Name: Arapandu's Flower
Description:
A flower gifted to you by Arapandu.
Can power the Varuna Contraption and adjust the amount of water contained within the earth, thus breathing new life into the forest.

Name: Arakunti's Flower
Description:
A flower gifted to you by Arakunti.
Happy moments spent with friends are like Nilotpala Lotuses in the water.

Name: Aranakula's Flower
Description:
A flower gifted to you by Aranakula.
Fearful though Aranakula was, this little creature still ventured into the Fungus-infested forest to tend to "the Memory of Stone."

Name: Arabalika's Flower
Description:
A flower gifted to you by Arabalika.
It seems to contain the power to destroy a Ruin Guard with one strike.

Name: Aranaga's Flower
Description:
A flower gifted to you by Aranaga.
"Season of rain returns, plants rejoice... The pomegranate sings, the apples clap."

Name: Aranakin's Flower
Description:
A flower gifted to you by Aranakin.
"Wind that doesn't return, water that doesn't flow backwards... Sweet dreams and bitter aftertastes."

Name: Aragaru's Flower
Description:
A flower gifted to you by Aragaru.
"Old leaves, swollen fruit... Drifted dreams, fallen flowers."

Name: Ararycan's Flower
Description:
A flower gifted to you by Ararycan.
There is neither soil nor water inside the Ruin Golem. It must be a nightmarish place for Ararycan.

Name: Araesha's Flower
Description:
A flower gifted to you by Araesha.
The biggest mystery is perhaps why Araesha describes the riddles as being "delicious"... Is it because they are all about food?

Name: Arakara's Flower
Description:
A flower gifted to you by Arakara.
For Arakara, who nurtures Viparyas, flowers given to friends must be most precious indeed.

Name: The Siblings' Flowers
Description:
Flowers gifted by Arapacati and her brothers.
Longing to be connected as "siblings" are, these Aranara have each taken on the role of sister or brother. Their obsession with cooking stems from the wish to share food with family.
That being said, an Aranara's tastebuds are not to be trusted.

Name: The Song Gatherers' Flowers
Description:
Flowers gifted to you by the Song Gatherers.
"No matter how dark the sky and land get, as long as your spirit emits warm, golden light like the sun, there will always be hope."

Name: Aralila and Aranishat's Flowers
Description:
Flowers gifted by Aralila and Aranishat.
We ourselves are the strongest. Of that, there is no doubt!

Name: Arakanta's Flower
Description:
A flower gifted by Arakanta.
Arakanta used to love hanging out with Rishboland Tigers. But now, he has created a new game for his Nara friend.

Name: Stories of You and the Aranara
Description: So many wonderful things transpired during your adventures with the Aranara. In the world of the Aranara where stories are highly valued, maybe someone is willing to "exchange" these with you.

Name: "Emergency Adjustment Plan"
Description: This map was contained within the plans that a Fatuus named Oleg accidentally dropped. All the encampment positions and Fatui patrol routes have been marked out here.

Name: Asterism Shard
Description: A mysterious shard engraved with a pattern of stars. It seems to be the key to solving a certain mechanism puzzle somewhere.

Name: Key
Description: A key that you found near the mysterious plant. This may be used to open a certain door in a high-up location within Xinyan's Mirage.

Name: Bottle of Spring Water
Description: A bottle of spring water. The Glacial Spring Water that Blazing Heart desires should be stored within.

Name: Frozen Soul's Petal
Description:
An uncanny petal. At first glance, it seems like ice molded into the shape of a petal, but it is quite soft to the touch.
"Plant my petal at the ending point of the intersection of melodies, and what had once sunk into the earth will re-emerge with the music."
That's what Frozen Soul said.

Name: Elegantly-Written Note
Description: An elegantly-written note.

Name: A Letter
Description: A letter.

Name: Rock Garden Rough Stone (Left)
Description: Mountain rocks. They look suited in all ways to be used as base materials from which to carve rocks for the bonsai's left side.

Name: Rock Garden Rough Stone (Right)
Description: Mountain rocks. They look suited in all ways to be used as base materials from which to carve rocks for the bonsai's right side.

Name: Rock Garden Carving Tools
Description: Carving tools that you found on the Mondstadt-style mountains. You might be able to use them to carve the base materials you have into a rock garden.

Name: Rock Garden Carving Tools
Description: Carving tools that you found on the Inazuma-style mountains. You might be able to use them to carve the base materials you have into a rock garden.

Name: Small Gear
Description: A small gear. No matter how small a gear is, it can be of use sometime, perhaps?

Name: Medium Gear
Description: A medium gear. "The pivotal one," as we call it.

Name: Drive Gear
Description: A gear that can transmit a measure of force. After all, momentum is key.

Name: Large Gear
Description: A large gear. Its weight and the noise it emits will make an impression for sure.

Name: Duplex Gear
Description: A rather small duplex gear. Double the flanks, double the labor hours.

Name: Large Duplex Gear
Description: A fairly large duplex gear. The bigger the size is, the more it takes to manufacture.

Name: Driven Gear
Description: A gear that requires power to rotate. It can be very helpful. Really. Can someone help rotate it, please?

Name: Leisurely Rocks: Left
Description: Slightly soft bonsai rocks. They seem to be able to summon a leisurely and comfy breeze. These can be placed on the left side of the bonsai.

Name: Leisurely Rocks: Right
Description: Slightly soft bonsai rocks. They seem to be able to summon a leisurely and comfy breeze. These can be placed on the right side of the bonsai.

Name: Hoverlight Rocks: Left
Description: Rocks of moderate hardness. It is said that a glimmer will dance across the surface of these rocks during stormy weather. These can be placed on the left side of the bonsai.

Name: Hoverlight Rocks: Right
Description: Bonsai rocks of moderate hardness. It is said that a glimmer will dance across the surface of these rocks during stormy weather. These can be placed on the right side of the bonsai.

Name: Unyielding Rocks: Left
Description: Very hard bonsai rocks that have an air of firmness to them. These can be placed on the left side of the bonsai.

Name: Unyielding Rocks: Right
Description: Very hard bonsai rocks that have an air of firmness to them. These can be placed on the right side of the bonsai.

Name: Living Spring
Description: Water obtained from the source of the rivers flowing across Apam Woods. According to Arapas, soup made from such spring water is a Supreme Delicacy. But one wonders if it really is any different from ordinary water...

Name: A Box of Components
Description: A box full of components. They all look quite intact, perhaps because monsters have no interest in them...

Name: Note of Unknown Origin: I
Description: You found this note in the mysterious space. Its content seems similar to that of a journal.

Name: Note of Unknown Origin: II
Description: You found this note in the mysterious space. Its content seems similar to that of a journal.

Name: Note of Unknown Origin: III
Description: You found this note in the mysterious space. Its content seems similar to that of a journal.

Name: Note of Unknown Origin: IV
Description: You found this note in the mysterious space. Its content seems similar to that of a journal.

Name: A Note
